DamageResistances: Bludgeoning, Slashing and Piercing from non-magical weapons

Traits.Name: Enhanced Strength
Traits.Content: The Lockjaw Boys have an innate strength that grants them advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

Traits.Name: Silent Communication
Traits.Content: Despite their inability to speak, Lockjaw Boys can communicate effectively with each other and their masters through gestures and body language.

Actions.Name: Brutal Assault
Actions.Content: The Lockjaw Boys make two attacks: a powerful slam with their fists and a forceful shoulder charge. The fist attack is +5 to hit, dealing 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is an enemy with lower than half its hit points, the shoulder charge adds an additional 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Silent Smash
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Fearsome Grapple
Actions.Content: The Lockjaw Boys attempt to grapple a target with their powerful hands. If successful, they deal 15 (3d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage as they crush their target and hold them tight. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be rendered incapacitated until they escape the grapple.
